result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:04 PM Defendant Joseph J. Hilgart appeared by phone.  Attorney Blake Gross appeared by video for Joseph J. Hilgart.  Attorney Ruth Diane Kressel appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Atty asking for plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.

1:50 PM Defendant Joseph J. Hilgart appeared by phone.  Attorney Blake Gross in court for Joseph J. Hilgart.  Attorney Ruth Diane Kressel appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Atty no prelim hearing, discussed rights and possible outcomes with def, waiving right to prelim hearing.  Atty is satisfied.  Court is satisfied and accepts waiver.  Court finds PC the def committed a felony in Ashland County and is bound over for arraignment.  State is filing information now, same charges.  Atty waives reading, stands mute on all charges, entered NG.
Status conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on October 31, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

State commenting -- proposal was just sent to Def yesterday -- case involved criminal case -- offer in this case is not involved w/ criminal case that's why State hasn't talked to Def.
